sentence: Looking at options trading activity among components of the Russell 3000 index, there is noteworthy activity today in Oclaro Inc. (Symbol: OCLR), where a total volume of 9,573 contracts has been traded thus far today, a contract volume which is representative of approximately 957,300 underlying shares (given that every 1 contract represents 100 underlying shares).
That number works out to 48.9% of OCLR's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 2.0 million shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $6 strike call option expiring August 19, 2016 , with 5,106 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 510,600 underlying shares of OCLR.

Below is a chart showing OCLR's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $6 strike highlighted in orange:

Select Comfort Corp. (Symbol: SCSS) saw options trading volume of 2,248 contracts, representing approximately 224,800 underlying shares or approximately 46.9% of SCSS's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 478,915 shares.
Particularly high volume was seen for the $21 strike put option expiring August 19, 2016 , with 2,135 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 213,500 underlying shares of SCSS.

Below is a chart showing SCSS's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $21 strike highlighted in orange:

And Salesforce.com Inc (Symbol: CRM) options are showing a volume of 16,988 contracts thus far today.
That number of contracts represents approximately 1.7 million underlying shares, working out to a sizeable 45.7% of CRM's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 3.7 million shares.
Particularly high volume was seen for the $81.50 strike call option expiring August 26, 2016 , with 2,561 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 256,100 underlying shares of CRM.

Below is a chart showing CRM's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $81.50 strike highlighted in orange:
